intro: Neohyptis paniculata, commonly known as the panicled hyptis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, with a slightly hairy texture. Neohyptis paniculata is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
